lexUnit.name: babble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk rapidly and continuously in a foolish, excited, or incomprehensible way

sentence.text: ` She 's all right , " she babbled .
` That 's O.K. , the firm pays for my taxi , " I babbled , holding it out to him between trembling fingers as if it were a dead insect .
` Nerve gas come , " the young terrorist babbled .
` She 's becoming a Genestealer , " babbled Googol .
` There , you see , " babbles the businessman .
` An inspector ! " babbled Malcolm .
Robert Plant , in his cheesecloth khurtan , flares and girly locks , babbling a lot of mystical bollocks , looked utterly absurd during those new times .
Gilbert waited for the lightning strike that would finally find them , and began to babble a hopeless prayer .
She was babbling something about helicopters .
Michael was after me , stumbling out on to the launch platform half-dressed and babbling about two-month training courses .
He kept babbling then about some fiend that had taken possession of him .
But I can remember my father coming back from the death bed and saying the old man was babbling about a grandson .
She saw us as allies and babbled to us in a mixture of French and Arabic throughout the hymns , then sighed loudly and looked out of the window as the prayers droned on .
I was babbling like an idiot . "
He must think she was babbling like a schoolgirl , but there was nothing even remotely schoolgirlish about her growing awareness of this man .
He reads the Koran , he attends daily prayers , and occasionally , when there is a gap in the conversation , he babbles of going to Mecca .

Quite suddenly , after they had refreshed themselves , the members of the garrison began to talk ; soon they were babbling away garrulously to their deliverers , laughing , cheering and even singing .
Knowing nothing , Ybreska continued to babble on excitedly .
As Kate babbled on , Maxine suddenly realized that her friend longed for a totally unworried love relationship .
I stared grimly across the room as Lorne babbled on .
Well , I did n't need much prompting , and soon babbled out all my dreams and dreads .
` But my daddy babbled out the truth . "

Urquhart led O'Neill to one of the second floor guest rooms , saying little as they wound their way through the mansion 's long corridors while O'Neill babbled away about whatever came into his mind .
She did n't know if Betty knew how long Beuno had been there , so endeavoured to give the impression that she could babble away on the topic of cooking game for hours at a time .
Hoomey felt a compulsion to babble on about what had happened , stimulated by their dice with the law , but Nails , now it was over , seemed unmoved .
Morenz had babbled on for nine seconds .
Oliver could be heard beginning a suitable reply before the woman babbled on about something else .
He babbled on without waiting for an answer .
The young girl inside her was babbling a little .
The artist had fussed around while the thing was being loaded on my ship , babbling about how important it was and how delicate it was and so on , until I 'd just stopped listening .
All these thoughts raced through Ruth 's head while Miss Beard continued to babble .
She was babbling , on the verge of hysteria , even a nervous breakdown .
He realized he had been babbling .
Elaine was aware that she was babbling .
Realising she was babbling , she started towards the galley .
Keith moves toward him , babbling , compounding the lie .
I tried to be quiet , " she said , knowing she was babbling but unable to prevent it .
She was panicking , she had lost control , she was almost babbling .
